A company uses Power Apps and Microsoft Dataverse.

The company has three solutions that you must move to a target environment:

• One solution is created for security roles. You must be able to add roles to the solution in the target environment.
• One solution is created for table additions and modifications. Table structures must be updated in the solution in the target environment.
• One solution is for customizations. The customizations must not be modified in the solution in the target environment.

You need to create the solutions.

Which type of solutions should you create? To answer, drag the appropriate solutions to the correct requirements. Each solution may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: 1. managed. permission is assigned in admin. not inside solution. 2. unmanaged. 3.unmanaged.

questions.question_text:
A company uses Microsoft Power Platform. You create a solution with components. You deploy the solution in the production environment.

Users report issues with a process. You open the last imported solution.

You need to troubleshoot the issue.

What should you view?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
As a developer, Solution history (option D) can be first verified and then options A, B, C can be used as next course of analysis. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/data-platform/solution-history explains the points covered in solution history

A company uses Microsoft Power Platform in a production environment. The company is defining new business processes in a prototyping environment. You create components in both environments.

You need to package the components you create.

Which solution types should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate solution types to the correct components. Each solution type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C in my opinion

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/windows-commands/set_1 
search with the word prompt in this page

Selected Answer: B
B. Plug-in configuration

A plug-in with an unsecure configuration allows for user input during the configuration process. It typically involves setting parameters or values that are required for the plug-in to execute properly. Therefore, when documenting the solution component type that prompts for user input, you should choose Plug-in configuration (Option B).

Selected Answer: C
The component type that prompts for user input is:

C. Environment variable

Explanation:

Environment variable:
Environment variables in Power Apps allow you to define settings or configuration values that can be used in different parts of your solution. When you create an environment variable, you can set a default value, but it may prompt for user input during the solution import if the value is not specified or if the value is different from the default when importing the solution into a new environment.
Options A, B, and D are not directly related to user input during solution import:

A. Connection reference:

Connection references in Power Platform are used to represent connections to external services or systems. They are not typically used to prompt for user input during solution import.
C. isn't Environment Variable the right choice?

questions.question_text:
A company uses Power Apps. The company creates a solution that contains the following items:

• environment setting
• flow that accesses Microsoft Dataverse
• plug-in with an unsecure configuration
• environment variable with a default value

The company plans to import solutions manually.

You need to document the solution component type that prompts for user input.

Which component type should you document?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It may not provide the most efficient and dynamic solution for real-time updates, but it works.
